intro: Tetrahit praecox, commonly known as the early tetrahit, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its early blooming habit, often appearing in late spring. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit.
